page.title: 12Extracts from 18C books
page.content: The following are extracts from local books published in the concerning The Frogmill. 1712 Atkyns:The Ancient and Present State of Gloucestershire. "Frogmill lying on the road between Oxford and Gloucester is within the Parish of Shipton Sollars." 1779 Rudder:A New History of Gloucestershire! "The Turnpike road from Gloucester to Oxford and London leads through the parish where there is a good inn called Frogmill on the east bank of the Coln." 1782 A Tour to Cheltenham Spa."Tis usual for those who have not their own carriages on coming to Cheltenham to take post chaise from frogmill thither." 1803 Ruff:History of Cheltenham. "Further is Frogmill a most comfortable house...."
